alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Frederick; Washington (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 14 at 2:30AM EST until December 15 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 PM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Freezing rain expected. Total ice accumulations of one to two tenths of an inch. Sleet may also mix in. * WHERE...In Maryland, Washington, Frederick MD and Carroll Counties. In Virginia, Northern Fauquier and Western Loudoun Counties. * WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 4 PM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Difficult travel conditions are possible. The hazardous conditions will likely impact the morning commute on Thursday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wintry precipitation begins this evening, then becomes more intense tonight into Thursday morning. Warmer air should push in Thursday afternoon changing the precipitation to rain.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
